descr: "Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Observation resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "A unique identifier assigned to this observation."

fields.name: basedOn
fields.descr: "A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "The status of the result value."

fields.name: _status
fields.descr: "Extensions for status"

fields.name: category
fields.descr: "A code that classifies the general type of observation being made."

fields.name: code
fields.descr: "Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation \"name\"."

fields.name: subject
fields.descr: "The patient, or group of patients, location, or device whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation and into whose record the observation is placed.  Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, donor,  other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject."

fields.name: context
fields.descr: "The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made."

fields.name: effectiveDateTime
fields.descr: "The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the \"physiologically relevant time\". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself."

fields.name: _effectiveDateTime
fields.descr: "Extensions for effectiveDateTime"

fields.name: effectivePeriod
fields.descr: "The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the \"physiologically relevant time\". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself."

fields.name: issued
fields.descr: "The date and time this observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified."

fields.name: _issued
fields.descr: "Extensions for issued"

fields.name: performer
fields.descr: "Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as \"true\"."

fields.name: valueQuantity
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: valueCodeableConcept
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: valueString
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: _valueString
fields.descr: "Extensions for valueString"

fields.name: valueBoolean
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: _valueBoolean
fields.descr: "Extensions for valueBoolean"

fields.name: valueRange
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: valueRatio
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: valueSampledData
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: valueAttachment
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: valueTime
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: _valueTime
fields.descr: "Extensions for valueTime"

fields.name: valueDateTime
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: _valueDateTime
fields.descr: "Extensions for valueDateTime"

fields.name: valuePeriod
fields.descr: "The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value."

fields.name: dataAbsentReason
fields.descr: "Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing."

fields.name: interpretation
fields.descr: "The assessment made based on the result of the observation.  Intended as a simple compact code often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result. Otherwise known as abnormal flag."

fields.name: comment
fields.descr: "May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result."

fields.name: _comment
fields.descr: "Extensions for comment"

fields.name: bodySite
fields.descr: "Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site)."

fields.name: method
fields.descr: "Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation."

fields.name: specimen
fields.descr: "The specimen that was used when this observation was made."

fields.name: device
fields.descr: "The device used to generate the observation data."

fields.name: referenceRange
fields.descr: "Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range."

fields.name: related
fields.descr: "A  reference to another resource (usually another Observation) whose relationship is defined by the relationship type code."

fields.name: component
fields.descr: "Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations."
